section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company (the Importer), to Pay invoices for orders received from your seller (the Exporter).

This module also enables a user at the importer to enter invoices received from the exporter. This is called a lodge scenario, and is useful if the exporter does not have or does not have this module.
In this chapter we generally assume that your company is the Importer.
In this chapter, we use the terms importer and buyer interchangeably, and we use the terms exporter and seller interchangeably,

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "IP" and "Invoice Payable" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Invoices Payable
section.para: A buyer can use to create Invoices payable and send them to the seller. The seller can then use this module to send the invoices payable to the bank.

section.title: Bank Involvement
section.para: The bank associated with these transactions is known as the Issuing Bank, just as in other modules, even though in this case it does not really issue anything. In this module the bank is more of an observer, since no bank approval is needed for Invoices and invoices to pass between buyer and seller.

If both the buyer and the seller are users of , the Invoices and invoices pass directly between them, and are sent to the Issuing Bank for information only, enabling the bank to offer services such as financing.

If only one of the companies is a user of , then communications between them are sent via the Issuing Bank. While one company uses to communicate with the bank, the other must use some other channel such as SWIFT TSU.

section.title: Counterparty Access
section.para: If your company (the Buyer) is not an existing user of , your Seller can arrange for you to have limited access to to use the modules.
When your Seller arranges for you to have access to , they should let you know the credentials (user ID, password, and abbreviated name for your company) you can use to log on.
Where a function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access, this chapter says so.

section.title: Invoice Payable Functions
section.para: In this module you can do the following:

listitem.para: Enter the details of an invoice, validate these details, and send the invoice to the buyer (copied also to the bank). This function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access.
Accept Invoices, Financing Request and Finance Repayment.
Display invoices under a single bulk reference ID
Display a list of all invoices that are still pending, which means invoices that have been initiated but not yet internally approved.
Display a list of all bulk invoices that are still pending, which means invoices that have been initiated but not yet internally approved.
Browse through all your company's existing invoices to review their details or history, and optionally print a hard copy of their transaction data.
Delete invoices, to clean up your workspace of outdated or incomplete transactions. This function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access.

Define the sections to be included in the Invoice Initiation form, and the formats available for the files you will upload in the Upload function. This function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access.

section.title: Payable Initiation
section.para: This section describes the Initiate function and the forms it uses. This function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access.

section.title: Payable Initiation Options
section.para:
This action has several sub-menu items, providing different ways to create an invoice.
From Scratch
Create a new Invoice Payable transaction from scratch.
Copy From Invoice Payable
Create a new Invoice Payable transaction by copying an existing invoice payable.
Upload
Upload an Invoice Payable into the .
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Invoice Payable records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit Invoice Payable records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Payable Initiation - From Scratch
section.para: The form for creating an invoice is as follows. This form is normally used by the seller to enter an invoice to be sent, but can be used by the buyer if entering details of an invoice received outside .

There are two options to create a new invoice
From Scratch
By selecting this option, you can follow the form for creating an invoice.
From Scratch (Simplified)
By selecting this option only the mandatory fields will appear which are General Details, Description of Goods, Bank Details and File Upload Details fields. All the other sections will be removed.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Unique reference number generated by for this invoice.
Enter a name used in the buyer company as a reference for this invoice.
Enter a name used in the seller company as a reference for this invoice.
(Read-only) Date when the invoice started to be created in your company.
Date of issue of the invoice.
Enter the date the Invoice is due to be paid.
Name and address details of the Buyer. The individual fields are described below.

row.entry: Entity creating the Invoice. This field is only present if your company has entities defined and you are attached to one or more entities. If you are attached to more than one, click the magnifying glass icon to select one. If you are attached to only one, the field is preset to that entity and cannot be changed.

entry.para: Enter the name of the buyer. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the BEI (Business Entity Identifier) of the buyer, if the company has been provided with such an ID. Maximum of 11 characters.
Enter the street name of the buyer. Maximum 70 characters.
Enter the post code of the buyer. Maximum of 16 characters.
Enter the town of the buyer. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country Sub Division. For example, state or county. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country code (ISO 3166) of the buyer. Maximum of 2 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon for a list of country codes.
Name and address of the seller. The individual fields are described below.
Enter the name of the seller. Click the magnifying glass icon to select from a list of sellers that your company maintains. Maximum of 35 characters.
Select the SCF programme applicable from the dropdown.

note.para: This field is enabled only if the company administrator has selected a SCF programme .

entry.para: BEI (Business Entity Identifier) of the seller, if the company has been provided with such an ID. Maximum of 11 characters.
Street name of the seller. Maximum 70 characters.
Post code of the seller. Maximum of 16 characters.
Town of the seller. Maximum of 35 characters.
For example, state or county. Maximum of 35 characters.
Country code (ISO 3166) of the seller. Maximum of 2 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon for a list of country codes.

Optionally, place a check mark here to display extra fields where you can enter additional names and addresses, for Bill To, Ship To, and Consignee. Do this if these are different from the name and address of the Buyer.
There is a tab for each. On each tab, the individual fields are the same as described above for Buyer and Seller (except there is no BEI field).
Enter the details of the party to be billed. (only displayed if Display Other Parties is ticked)
Enter the name of the party to be billed. Click the magnifying glass icon to select from a list of counterparties that your company maintains. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the street name of the party to be billed. Maximum 70 characters.
Enter the post code of the party to be billed. Maximum of 16 characters.
Enter the town of the party to be billed. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country Sub Division. For example, state or county. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country code (ISO 3166) of the party to be billed. Maximum of 2 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon for a list of country codes.
Enter the details of the party to be Shipped To. (only displayed if Display Other Parties is ticked)
Enter the name of the party to be Shipped To. Click the magnifying glass icon to select from a list of counterparties that your company maintains. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the street name of the party to be Shipped To. Maximum 70 characters.
Enter the post code of the party to be Shipped To. Maximum of 16 characters.
Enter the town of the party to be Shipped To. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country Sub Division. For example, state or county. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country code (ISO 3166) of the party to be Shipped To. Maximum of 2 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon for a list of country codes.
Enter the details of the Consignee. (only displayed if Display Other Parties is ticked)
Enter the name of the Consignee. Click the magnifying glass icon to select from a list of counterparties that your company maintains. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the street name of the Consignee. Maximum 70 characters.
Enter the post code of the Consignee. Maximum of 16 characters.
Enter the town of the Consignee. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country Sub Division. For example, state or county. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country code (ISO 3166) of the Consignee. Maximum of 2 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon for a list of country codes.

section.title: From Scratch form - Description of Goods
section.para: In this section you describe the goods covered by the Purchase Order. Each product is called a Line Item.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
(Optional) Short summary of the goods. Up to 2 lines of 35 characters.
Click the magnifying glass icon to set the currency to be used throughout this Invoice.

The value printed or depicted on the invoice
Only apply to Simplified Invoice
(Optional)Addition of all adjustment
(Optional) If the amount of adjustment should be added or subtracted.
The invoice amount after adjustment
Display a sub-form where you enter the details of a Line Item. The sub-form is described in the section Line Item Sub-form below.

The total goods amount is automatically computed and displayed, as the sum of the amounts of the Line Items. The currency is automatically set to the same as the Purchase Order Currency described above. (If you change the Purchase Order Currency, this field is updated when you next click on the form.)

section.title: From Scratch form - Line Item subform - Amount Details
section.para: This part of the Line Item sub-form defines the quantities and price of the Line Item.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Enter the unique item number for this item of goods.

entry.para: This part of the sub-form defines the quantity of the Product.

row.entry: Enter the name of the product.
Enter the country of origin for this product. Click the magnifying glass icon for a list of country codes.
This section contains details regarding the quantity of the product in this line item.

entry.para: Unit of measure, for example, kilo or ton. Select from the dropdown list of standard quantity codes, which ranges from container/piece/cartons to weight or surface measures.
If you select Other Measure a field appears where you can enter your own unit of measure.

row.entry: Enter details if "Other Measure" is selected for Quantity Code.

entry.para: Quantity of product for this Line Item, specified by a number. For example, 100 (kgs), 50 (pieces).
Multiplication factor of measurement value. For example: goods that can be ordered by 36 pieces.
Note: this factor is not used for any computations, and the price is given for the specified quantity code (for example for the carton or container).
Enter the variance (percentage) allowed over the agreed amount. Maximum of two digits.
Enter the variance (percentage) allowed below the agreed amount. Maximum of two digits.
This part of the sub-form defines the price for the chosen quantity, and the corresponding total price.
(Read-only) Reminder of the quantity measure chosen above.
Enter the Unit price expressed as a currency (three alphabetic characters) and amount. The currency field is read-only and is a reminder of the currency chosen above.
This data is optional. If the value is specified, the Line Item amount is automatically computed based on the above Quantity and this Unit Price.
Enter the multiplication factor of measurement value. For example: goods that can be ordered by 36 pieces.
Note: this factor is not used for any computations, and the price is given for the specified quantity code (for example for the carton or container).
Note: you can choose to define this informative data at the Quantity level or at the Price level or both.
Enter the variance (percentage) allowed over the agreed amount. Maximum of two digits.
You can choose to define this informative data at the Quantity level or at the Price level or both.
Variance (percentage) allowed below the agreed amount. Maximum of two digits.
You can choose to define this informative data at the Quantity level or at the Price level or both.
Total amount of the Line Item after any adjustments have been applied.
If the Unit Price value is specified above, the Line Item amount is automatically computed based on the Quantity and Unit Price
Total amount Net amount of the Line Item before any adjustments have been applied.
If the Unit Price value is specified above, the Line Item amount is automatically computed based on the Quantity and Unit Price
This section contains shipment details.
Enter the latest date the goods can be shipped.

section.title: From Scratch form - Line Item Subform - End of Sub-form
section.para: At the end of the Line Item sub-form are the usual OK and Cancel buttons:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Add the Line Item to the list of Line Items for the Invoice, and close the sub-form.
Close the sub-form without adding the Line Item.
Field
Type
Description
Pair of option buttons, showing whether the payment terms are defined by Amount or by Percentage.
Click to display a sub-form to define a new Payment Term. The individual fields are described below.

Condition or type of event when the payment should occur. Select from the dropdown list: Payment On Delivery, End Of Month Of Delivery, End Of Period After Delivery, End Of Period After End Of Delivery Month, Payment On Receipt Of Invoice, End Of Period After End Of Receipt Month, End Of Period After Receipt, End Of Month Of Receipt.
Select Other Payment type to display a field where you can enter a value in free-format text.
(Optional) Number of days associated with the condition chosen. Up to 3 characters. Not available if you have selected Other Payment type.
Text field where you can enter free-format text. Up to 4 lines of 35 characters. Only available if you have selected Other Payment type.
Percentage of the PO amount that this payment term applies to. Up to 12 characters. Only available if you set Details per to Percentage.
Currency and amount for this payment term. The currency is automatically set to the same as the Purchase Order Currency described above. Only available if you set Details per to Amount.
Add the entry to the list of payment terms, and close the sub-form.
Close the sub-form without adding the entry.

section.title: From Scratch form - Settlement Terms
section.para: In tis section you specifiy the seller's account, into which payment is to be made.

Type
Description
Details of the account to be credited. The individual fields are described below..
Select from the dropdown list: IBAN, BBAN, UPIC or Other.
Name on the account. Maximum of 35 characters.
Number of the account. This field is validated to ensure that it conforms to the format required for an account of the type selected.

Reference (multi-purpose string that, for instance, may identify the liability line) under which the transaction should be recorded. Select from the dropdown list; this displays references defined for the selected Issuing Bank.

note.para: The list of references is defined and maintained by the bank. If the bank doesn't wish to define and use references per Bank, a non bank-specific Reference field appears in the Applicant Details section instead.

section.title: From Scratch form - Incoterms
section.para: This section defines Incoterms for the Invoice Payable. Incoterms can be defined either here for the Invoice Payable as a whole, or earlier in the form for individual Line Items, but not both.
The section begins with a list of Incoterms that have already been added. If none have been added, there is simply a text "No Incoterm".
Then comes a link Add an incoterm, which you can click to display a further sub-form where you can add another Incoterm.

The format of the list is as follows. Click the Edit
or Delete
icon next to an item in the list to edit or delete it.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Code indicating the Incoterm.

entry.para: Text field giving details.

section.para: The format of the sub-form used for adding or editing an Incoterm is as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Code indicating the Incoterm, describing the responsibilities of the seller and buyer in the current transaction. Select from the dropdown list of values (Infoterm 2000):
entry.programlisting: EXW - EX WORKS FCA - FREE CARRIER FAS - FREE ALONGSIDE SHIP FOB - FREE ON BOARD CFR - COST AND FREIGHT CIF - COST, INSURANCE AND FREIGHT CPT - CARRIAGE PAID TO CIP - CARRIAGE AND INSURANCE PAID TO DAF - DELIVERED AT FRONTIER DES - DELIVERED EX SHIP DEQ - DELIVERED EX QUAY DDU - DELIVERED DUTY UNPAID DDP - DELIVERED DUTY PAID OTHER
entry.para: Select OTHER to display a field where you can enter a value in free-format text.
Geographical place known to the trading partners at which risk passes from one Business party to another according to the Incoterm selected above. Up to 35 characters.
Mandatory if an Incoterm has been selected.
Add the entry to the list of Incoterms for the Line Item, and close the sub-form.
Close the sub-form without adding the entry.

section.title: From Scratch form - Routing Summary
section.para: This section gives a routing summary for the goods in the Invoice Payable. A Routing Summary can be defined either here for the Invoice Payable as a whole, or earlier in the form for individual Line Items, but not both.
This section has the same format as the equivalent section for an individual Line Item. .

section.title: From Scratch form - User Information
section.para: This section contains free-format items giving any further information supplied by the buyer or seller. It has a subsection for Buyer Information and a subsection for Seller Information. Both subsections have the same format.

The section begins with a list of items of information that have already been added. If none have been added, there is simply a text "No Buyer Defined Information" (or "No Seller Defined Information").
Then comes a link Add a Buyer Information (or Add a Seller Information), which you can click to display a further sub-form where you can add another entry.

In each subsection, click the Edit
or Delete
icon next to an item in the list to edit or delete it. Click OK on the sub-form to add the new entry to the list and close the sub-form, or Cancel to close the sub-form without adding it.
The format of the list is as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Label to identify and describe the item.

entry.para: Text field giving details.

section.para: The format of the sub-form used for adding or editing an entry is as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Label to identify and describe the item.

entry.para: Text field giving details.

section.title: From Scratch form - Contact Person
section.para: This section contains details of one or more people who are the contacts within the company.
The section begins with a list of people that have already been added. If none have been added, there is simply a text "No Contact Person".
Then comes a link Add a Contact Person, which you can click to display a further sub-form where you can add another entry.

Click the Edit
or Delete
icon next to an item in the list to edit or delete it. Click OK on the sub-form to add the new entry to the list and close the sub-form, or Cancel to close the sub-form without adding it.

The list does not show all a person's details, so click the the Edit
icon to view them.
The format of the list is as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Role of the person's company in this transaction - for example, buyer or seller.

entry.para: Full name

section.para: The format of the sub-form used for adding or editing an entry is as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Role of the contact's company in this transaction - for example, buyer or seller. Select from the dropdown list.

entry.para: Title, for example Doctor or MIss. Select from the dropdown list.
Name of the contact. Up to 35 characters.
Given name of the contact. Up to 35 characters.
Contact's position in the company. Up to 35 characters.

Telephone number of the contact. Must begin with "+" and the country code (up to 3 digits), then "-" followed by the rest of the number. Can contain further "-" characters, but other punctuation and spaces are not allowed.
Fax number of the contact. Same format as telephone number.
Email address of the contact. The format is not validated.

section.title: From Scratch form - File Upload Details

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: This column doesn't have a header and displays icons for the type of file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
This column shows the title of all documents that have been uploaded for the Invoice Payable. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
This column shows the file names of all documents that have been uploaded with the Invoice Payable. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

entry.para: Click this button to download the file to the local system. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
Click this button to delete the uploaded file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

Click this button to attach a file from your local system to give additional details pertaining to this Invoice Payable request. It will open the File Details popup. Enter the title for the file upload and browse to the location of the file, and select the file to upload.

note.para: The maximum size allowed for each file attachment is defined in a properties file of the system.

section.title: From Scratch form - Actions
section.para: The operations that you can perform from the Invoice initiation pages are listed below. For each of them, a popup window asks you to confirm your choice.

entry.para: Name
Type
Description

row.entry: Click this button to save the invoice payable request. The request will be saved with a status of "Draft" and can be updated and finalised at a later time.

This option will submit the invoice payable request for submission to the bank. If further Authorisations are required, it will be held back with a status of "Unsigned" until submitted by an Authorizing user.

entry.para: Click this button to cancel the creation of the current invoice payable request and to clear any details.
This button displays an online help facility that describes the fields associated with the invoice payable request.

section.title: Payable Initiation - Copy From Invoice Payable
section.para: Select this option to create a new Invoice payable, using an existing one as a model. The standard Invoice payable form will be displayed, with most fields populated with values from the original Invoice payable form.

Click on the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter. These are System Id, Entity, Buyer Name or Ccy field. To display all templates, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing. The standard Invoice form will be displayed, with most fields populated with values from the original Invoice record. Complete or change the required fields in the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when complete.

section.title: Payable Initiation - Upload
section.para: External invoice payables can be uploaded into using this option. It allows invoice payables to be analysed and broken down according to templates created in the Invoice Payable: Parameters Function. Refer to the Parameters section in this topic for more information.

section.title: Upload Form - General Details
section.para: The input form for you to upload a file containing invoice details is as follows.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
(Read-only) Date when the invoice started to be created in your company.

section.title: Upload Form - Buyer Details
section.para: The input form for you to upload a file containing invoice details is as follows.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Entity creating the Invoice. This field is only present if your company has entities defined and you are attached to one or more entities. If you are attached to more than one, click the magnifying glass icon to select one. If you are attached to only one, the field is preset to that entity and cannot be changed.

entry.para: Enter the name of the buyer. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the BEI (Business Entity Identifier) of the buyer, if the company has been provided with such an ID. Maximum of 11 characters.
Enter the street name of the buyer. Maximum 70 characters.
Enter the post code of the buyer. Maximum of 16 characters.
Enter the town of the buyer. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country Sub Division. For example, state or county. Maximum of 35 characters.
Enter the Country code (ISO 3166) of the buyer. Maximum of 2 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon for a list of country codes.
Field
Type
Description

Bank that your company is dealing with; typically this bank (as well as the exporter) will receive tour Invoice. Select from the dropdown list; this displays only the banks that your company has a relationship with.

Reference (multi-purpose string that, for instance, may identify the liability line) under which the transaction should be recorded. Select from the dropdown list; this displays references defined for the selected Issuing Bank.

note.para: The list of references is defined and maintained by the bank. If the bank doesn't wish to define and use references per Bank, a non bank-specific Reference field appears in the Applicant Details section instead.

section.title: Upload Form - Template Details
section.para: This section defines the template to be used when uploading invoice files.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Specify the Upload template to be used for these invoices. Templates are created using the "Invoice Payable - Parameters" function.
Check this box to submit invoices that the system can prepare from the file. Invoices that cannot be submitted can be retrieved and edited using the "retrieve Draft" function.
entry.note: For simplified upload invoice it is already checked

entry.para: Override line items before submission.
Add line items before submission.

section.para: The format of the sub-form used for editing a payment term is as follows. You can only alter the amount.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: This column doesn't have a header and displays icons for the type of file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
This column shows the title of all documents that have been uploaded for the Invoice Payable. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
This column shows the file names of all documents that have been uploaded with the Invoice Payable. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

entry.para: Click this button to download the file to the local system. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
Click this button to delete the uploaded file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

Click this button to attach a file from your local system to give additional details pertaining to this Invoice Payable request. It will open the File Details popup. Enter the title for the file upload and browse to the location of the file, and select the file to upload.

note.para: The maximum size allowed for each file attachment is defined in a properties file of the system.

section.title: Payable Initiation - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows Invoice Payable records that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Invoice Payable records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Payable Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows Invoice Payable records that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Invoice Payable records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Messages
section.para:
The message function allows to accept finance request and finance repayment requests. It contains the following options.
Financing Request
Request finance for a payable invoice.
Finance Repayment
Request finance repayment for a payable invoice.
Accept Invoices
Accept invoices initiated by Seller.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Invoice Payable records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit Invoice Payable records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Messages - Finance Request
section.para: When this option is selected, a list of existing Invoices (eligible/non eligible) are displayed.

This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Entity/Seller Name, Invoice Reference, Buyer Name, Ccy, Invoice Due Date From and To Dates, Status or Base Ccy field. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

para.note: Only eligible invoices can be requested for finance request

section.para: There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. Click on the Download button and select the required format. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.

The columns returned in the list are described in the following table:
Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Entity/Seller Name
The seller and the entity associated with the seller.
Invoice reference
The ID used by the Buyer to identify the invoice
Buyer Name
The buyer name as identified on the invoice.
Ccy
The Currency of the Invoice.
Outstanding Amount
The outstanding amount of the invoice.
Invoice Amount in Base Ccy
The amount of the invoice in the base currency of your company.
Status
Current status of the invoice
Issue Date
The date the invoice was issued.
Invoice Due Date
The date the invoice is due for Payment.
Tick the Check box on the left of each entry you wish to accept and click the Submit button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Messages - Finance Repayment
section.para: When this option is selected, a list of existing Financed Invoices are displayed.

This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Entity/Seller Name, Buyer Name, Program name, Ccy, Financed Amount From/To, Outstanding Repayment Amount From/To, Finance Issue Date From/To, or Finance Due Date From/To field. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the list to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the list to your machine as a spreadsheet.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. Click on the Download button and select the required format. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.

The columns returned in the list are described in the following table:
Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Entity/Seller Name
The seller and the entity associated with the seller.
Buyer Name
The buyer name as identified on the invoice.
Program Name
The name of the program.
CCY
The Currency of the Invoice.
Financed Amount
The amount financed by the bank.
Outstanding Repayment Amount
The outstanding repayment amount of the invoice.
Finance Issue Date
The date the invoice was financed.
Finance Due Date
The date the invoice is due for finance.
Status
Current status of the invoice
Tick the Check box on the left of each entry you wish to accept and click the Submit button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Messages - Accept Invoice
section.para: When this option is selected, a list of invoices waiting to be accepted is displayed.

This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity/Buyer Name, Invoice Reference, Seller Name, Ccy or Invoice Due Date field. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list are described below:

entry.para: Field
Description
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
The buyer and the entity associated with the buyer.
The ID used by the seller to identify the invoice
The seller name as identified on the invoice.
The Currency of the Invoice.
The amount of the invoice.
The date the invoice was raised.
The date the invoice is due.

section.para: Click on the System ID field to display the invoice and click the Accept button to accept the Invoice or on Reject to reject the invoice

section.title: Messages - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows records that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Messages - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows records that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Bulk Financing
section.para: You can club many invoices under a single bulk reference ID.

para.note: Only eligible invoices can be clubbed

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Unique reference id provided by the system to identify the Bulk.
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Field
Type
Description
Select the name of the bank from the dropdown menu
The reference of the issuer

section.title: Financing Request - Invoices
section.para: The Invoices Payable selected for this entity will be display in a table. To add an Invoice Payable, click on Add Invoices.

A pop up window will appear with the list of Invoices Payable. You can use the Search Option thanks to the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are System ID, Buyer Name, Currency, Program Name, Amount, Invoice Date, Invoice Due Date field.
The columns returned in the list of Invoice Payable records are the following:

entry.para: Field
Description
Unique reference number generated by Fusion Corporate Channels for this invoice
The Entity associated with the transaction
The name of the program for this invoice (mandatory)
The buyer name as identified on the invoice
The currency of the invoice
The amount of the invoice
The amount of the invoice
The date the invoice was issued
The date the invoice is due for Payment.
Current status of the invoice.

section.para: On the left side, you can tick the invoice payable you want to add, and then click OK.

section.title: Financing Request - Instruction for the Bank Only
section.para: Enter instructions for the bank. The following table provides details for this section:

entry.para: Field
Description

row.entry: Enter any instructions for the transaction in this text box. You can also select from a list of phrases in the system. Click on the List of Phrases icon and a popup with the list of phrases appears. If required, enter values for abbreviated name, or description, or text, or a combination of desired values, and click on the Search button to refine the list. Click on the required phrase from the list to select it and it appears in the text box.

section.title: Edit Transaction
section.para: This option allows an Invoice Payable Bulk Financing that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Bulk Financing that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows an Invoice Payable Bulk Financing that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Invoice Payable Bulk Financing that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Bulk Invoice Payable Inquiry
section.para: This function will display a list of all Bulk Invoice Payable records that have been submitted to and acknowledge by the bank. The inquiry screen can be used to check for Bulk Invoices Payable that are accepted, rejected or partially approved.

The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Base Currency, Total Amount, Financed Amount or Status fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. The details for the columns returned in the list of Bulk are in the following table:

entry.para: Field
Description

row.entry: Unique reference number generated by Fusion Corporate Channels for this file when it was initiated.

entry.para: The entity associated with the transaction.
The amount of the invoice in the base currency of your company.

row.entry: The total amount for the bulk Invoice.
The amount financed for the bulk invoice.
The status of the bulk (accepted, rejected or partially approved).

section.title: Bulk Invoice Payable Maintenance
section.para: This function is used to maintain Bulk Invoice Payable records that were created, but are no longer required in the system. They can also be deleted.

section.title: Pending Invoice Payable
section.para: Display a list of your company's invoice payables that are pending.
This is typically used by a manager to monitor the consolidated list of invoices received but not yet payed.

It also gives quick access to the actions required to interact with a given transaction record. Therefore, depending on the state of the record, you can open the record either in edit mode or in review/signature mode (only if it has been submitted before but is still pending for additional credentials).
The list displays invoices of types:
and whose transaction statuses are:

listitem.para: Incomplete (the input user saved it as a draft, using Save; it could be retrieved using the Retrieve Draft menu item)
Uncontrolled (the input user tried to submit it, using Submit, but did not have sufficient privilege; it could be retrieved using the Retrieve Unsigned menu item)

section.para: This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Seller Name or CCY field. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.

The columns returned in the list of stuff are the following:
Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Type
The type of record. (New, etc.)
Status
The status of the Invoice Payable record. (Incomplete, Draft, Etc.)
Seller Name
The seller name as identified on the invoice.
CCY
The Currency of the Invoice.
Amount
The amount of the Amount.
Input Date
The date the record was created in the system.
Each record is shown with one or two action icons, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Open the record in edit mode in order to change its details (same as selecting a record in Draft Presentation).
Open the record in non-editable mode.

section.title: Pending Bulk Invoices Payable
section.para: Display a list of your company's bulk invoices payable that are pending.
This is typically used by a manager to monitor the consolidated list of bulk invoices payable received but not yet payed.

This function will display a list of all bulk invoice payable records that have not been submitted to or acknowledge by the bank.. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System ID, Status and Amount fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of stuff are the following:

entry.para: Field
Description
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
The Entity associated with the transaction.
The number of invoices payable which are part of the bulk
The amount of the invoice in the base currency of your company
The amount of the bulk invoice payable
The status of the bulk invoice.
Associated users

section.para: Each record is shown with one or two action icons, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Open the record in edit mode in order to change its details (same as selecting a record in Draft Presentation).
Open the record in non-editable mode.

section.title: Invoice Payable Inquiry
section.para: Display a list of invoices that your company (the Buyer) has received, so that you can check their status or anything related to their details or history.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Invoice Reference, Seller Name and CCY fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The Status column shows the current state of the transaction and can have the following values:
There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.

The columns returned in the list of stuff are the following:
Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Invoice Reference
The Reference Id of the Reference.
Seller Name
The seller name as identified on the invoice.
CCY
The Currency of the Invoice.
Amount
The amount of the Amount.
Issue Date
The date the Invoice was Issued.
Status
The status of the Invoice Payable record. (Incomplete, Draft, Etc.)
Each record is shown with two action icons:

entry.para: Visual
Description
Open a popup window displaying the current master details of the record.

(History) Display a list of all events for the record, detailing the complete history of the file. For each event in the life of the file, the list shows the Release Date, the Type of the event, the Status, the Currency and transaction Amount (e.g. the Purchase Order amount), and the identities of the input and supervising users.

section.para: On the History page, you can click in the Release column to open a popup window showing full details of each event. Within the popup, the Event Details section shows the key details of the event. It shows any additional instructions and attachment provided by the customer as well as the bank's comment and attachments given as part of the reporting.

If the Event Details header in the popup window shows a Release Date/Time, it means the time the validated transaction event was released by the buyer to the seller.
The timestamp is shown in user timezone by default. However, it can be changed by setting the property display.datetime.in.user.timezone to 'False' which shows the bank timezone. Banks which want to retain the earlier configuration need to set the listed property to 'False' as well.

The Date/Time field that accompanies a Message header means the time the reporting message was released by the seller to the buyer.
The timestamp is shown in user timezone by default. However, it can be changed by setting the property display.datetime.in.user.timezone to 'False' which shows the bank timezone. Banks which want to retain the earlier configuration need to set the listed property to 'False' as well.

You can also export the history report as an external file in CSV format, by choosing CSV in the Output Format list box and clicking the icon
. The name of the file downloaded is the System Id of the transaction together with a .csv extension - for example, if the invoice has the system identifier IP0110001008., the filename is IP0110001008.csv (where the first "O" is the letter O, not zero).

section.title: Invoice Payable Maintenance
section.para: This function may not be present if you have limited counterparty access.

Perform maintenance tasks on invoice records handled by your company. You can assign an entity to a record, and you can delete from the system outdated transaction records or records whose status has been marked as Purged.

note.para: Deleted records are physically removed from the system. This task should therefore be conducted with great care!

section.title: Invoice Payable Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: Assign an entity to an invoice payable record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no entity assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign an entity to the record.
Note that this action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: Invoice Payable Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to an invoice payable record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.
Note that this action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: Invoice Payable Maintenance - Unsigned Invoice Payable
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). Click in the System Id column to select the invoice for deletion, and click the "Delete selected transactions" button.
Note that this action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix.

section.title: Invoice Payable Maintenance - Purged Invoice Payable
section.para: Display a list of invoices that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team (if your company does not have a direct connection to the bank's system, messages to purge invoices are sent by the bank to your system by other means such as SWIFT TSU). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

You can delete multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page deletes all the selected records.

section.title: Parameters
section.para: Set up parameters to be used by other functions on this menu.

section.title: Parameters - Upload
section.para: List and maintain Invoice Payable Upload Templates. Define the format to be used in the files used in the Invoice Payables Initiation > Upload function. When this option is selected, a list of templates is displayed. This list can be searched for a specific Template. Click on the template name to review its layout.
Alternatively, the Add Template button can be used to create a new template. When an existing or new template is selected, the following form appears.

section.title: Upload template form - General Details
section.para: This section is a reminder of your company's name and address as they will appear in your forms. These details cannot be changed here.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Name of the Upload Template.
Description and use of the template.

Select one of the following:Fixed Size - Each column will be a fixed size defined when columns are added Delimited - If selected, the delimeter characted must also be specified from the dropdown menu.
Check this box if the template is to be released.

section.title: Upload form - Mapped Columns
section.para: This section defines the mapping for each column of the upload template. Add each column in the order they appear in the uploaded file. All highlighted columns must be included.
Click on each added column and add the format of each field, and if "Fixed Size", the start position and length, in the boxes displayed at the bottom of the list.

section.title: Parameters - Simplified Upload
section.para: List and maintain Invoice Payable Upload Templates. Define the format to be used in the files used in the Invoice Payables Initiation > Upload function. When this option is selected, a list of templates is displayed. This list can be searched for a specific Template. Click on the template name to review its layout.
Alternatively, the Add Template button can be used to create a new template. When an existing or new template is selected, the following form appears.

section.title: Upload template form - General Details
section.para: This section is a reminder of your company's name and address as they will appear in your forms. These details cannot be changed here.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Name of the Upload Template.
Description and use of the template.

Select one of the following:Fixed Size - Each column will be a fixed size defined when columns are added Delimited - If selected, the delimeter characted must also be specified from the dropdown menu.
Check this box if the template is to be released.

section.title: Upload form - Mapped Columns
section.para: This section defines the mapping for each column of the upload template. Add each column in the order they appear in the uploaded file. All highlighted columns must be included.
Click on each added column and add the format of each field, and if "Fixed Size", the start position and length, in the boxes displayed at the bottom of the list.
